bioghist.p: To mark the 100th anniversary of Swarthmore's founding, the college established the Centennial Fund campaign of 1963-64. The goal of this campaign was to raise $10,000,000. Thomas B. McCabe was the campaign's chairman and Wolcott D. Street was the campaign director.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records related to development activities at Swarthmore College. Much of the collection consists of records of the Centennial Fund campaign, including: reports, financial statements, memos, and minutes; appeals to individual and corporate donors; subject files on foundations and corporations; campaign literature for the Centennial Fund and for previous campaigns at Swarthmore; donor lists; administrative and financial records of the campaign office. The collection also contains files from the office of Swarthmore Vice President Joseph B. Shane. These records include: correspondence related to alumni relations and donations; documentation of student activities and policies, such as the alcohol policy, student conduct, and opposition to the draft; and documentation of other college events, including the dedication of McCabe Library.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
